What is the fundamental rule of lexical scoping?
answer_1: Functions are declared in the scope
answer_2: Functions are executed using scope chain
answer_3: Functions are declared outside the scope
answer_4: Variables are declared within the function
right_answer: Functions are executed using scope chain

title: What is the opposite approach to the lexical scoping?
What is the purpose of the dynamic scoping?
answer_1: Variables can be declared outside the scope
answer_2: Variables must be declared outside the scope
answer_3: Variables cannot be declared outside the scope
answer_4: Variable cannot be declared within the function
right_answer: Variables can be declared outside the scope
